alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Maryland Beaches; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 9:34PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Wicomico and northern Worcester Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 934 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Snow Hill, or 11 miles southeast of Salisbury University, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ocean City, Berlin, Snow Hill, Cape Isle Of Wight, Ocean Pines, Newark, Willards, Bishop, Ocean City Municipality, Bishopville, Ironshire, West Ocean City, Longridge, Powellville, Whaleyville, Showell and Whiton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
